result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucas J Roffers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay restitution to Jamal R. in the stipulated amount of $32.00.

*Court ordered defendant to pay restitution to Jamal R., in the stipulated amount of $32.00; then pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges.  All are ordered to be paid from prison funds collected by the Department of Corrections not to exceed 25%.  Balance to be paid while on extended supervision.  Failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
Concurrent with: With count 2, time served disposition.

*Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges.  All are ordered to be paid from prison funds collected by the Department of Corrections not to exceed 25%.  Balance to be paid while on extended supervision.  Failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
Concurrent with: With count 1, time served disposition.

*Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lucas J Roffers in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Lucas J Roffers in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 1:  Court sentences defendant to serve 26 days  in the House of Correction, concurrent to Count 2, with credit for 26 days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

As to Count 2:  Court sentences defendant to serve 26 days  in the House of Correction, concurrent to Count 1, with credit for 26 days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered defendant to pay restitution to Jamal R., in the stipulated amount of $32.00; then pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges.  All are ordered to be paid from prison funds collected by the Department of Corrections not to exceed 25%.  Balance to be paid while on extended supervision.  Failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 

filed:  Pretrial Incarceration Credit, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in br. 33.

Court orders a $500.00 PR bond with turnover to JusticePoint.

Defendant Lucas J Roffers in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Lucas J Roffers in custody.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for August 7, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Case transferred to br 6 for drug treatment court admissions on7/30/2014 at 1:30pm.  lms
(8/25/2014 court date in br 20 is cancelled)
Br. 06 clerk notified of July date, however, case must be set out 30 days. Next court date is 8/25/14 at 8:30 a.m. for status before Branch 20 to allow placement to proceed.

Defendant Lucas J Roffers in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter.  Defendant Lucas J Roffers in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties advise the Court that due to the amendment of the charge in 14CF54, defendant would now be eligible for drug treatment court.  Court allowed for transfer of same to Branch 06.  Attorney Carpenter advised the Court that the next court date set in Branch 06 is 7/30/14 at 8:30 a.m.

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lucas J Roffers in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Lucas J Roffers in custody.  Kimberly Schoepp for Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Arraignment scheduled for May 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kathrina R.; Khristina R or 2358 S 33rd Street, Milwaukee, WI

Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
